title: markdown
text:
Running Code
When you click the Render button a document will be generated that includes both content and the output of embedded code. You can embed code like this:

1 + 1

[1] 2


You can add options to executable code like this


[1] 4

title: Training Information
text: The goal of this workshop is to equip participants with the ability to recognize and produce data visualizations in accordance with the best practices of the field. Looking forward to meeting you all!

title: Training Information
text:
Venue
The workshop takes place at the Kigali Marriott Hotel in Kigali, Rwanda on April 19th 2024. We will begin at 9:30am and finish at 1pm (see schedule below). If you have had any trouble with software installation, please arrive 15 minutes prior to the beginning of the session so we can assist you.

title: Training Information
text:
Before the Workshop
Please install R, RStudio, and the ggplot2 library following these installation instructions. If you have any trouble installing we will have a station on 18th April where you can come for assistance. Installation might take 15 minutes or more even on a good internet connection, so please install ahead of time!
Please also download the data we will be using for the workshop ahead of time. You should also receive this data as an attachment in your email. If you are having trouble downloading the data, please put a red sticky note on your computer and we will assist you.






Note




All software used in this workshop is free.
If you have any difficulties with the installation, support can be provided on the first day of the AMMnet meeting, before the session, during breaks.

title: Training Information
text:
Schedule








Time
Session





9:15-9:30
Welcome
Support for software installation



9:30 - 9:50
Introduction to Data Visualization



9:50-10:05
Getting Familiar with RStudio, Reading Data



10:05-11:00
Introduction to ggplot2 and geoms



11-11:30
Coffee Break



11:30-12:15
Mapping aesthetics: the aes() function



12:15-12:45
Customizing Plots for Presentation & Publication



12:45-13:00
Conclusion and Survey

title: Training Information
text:
After the Workshop
Fill out the online post-workshop questionnaire

title: learning
text:
This is an R Markdown document. Markdown is a simple formatting syntax for authoring HTML, PDF, and MS Word documents. For more details on using R Markdown see http://rmarkdown.rstudio.com.
When you click the Knit button a document will be generated that includes both content as well as the output of any embedded R code chunks within the document. You can embed an R code chunk like this:

summary(cars)

     speed           dist       
 Min.   : 4.0   Min.   :  2.00  
 1st Qu.:12.0   1st Qu.: 26.00  
 Median :15.0   Median : 36.00  
 Mean   :15.4   Mean   : 42.98  
 3rd Qu.:19.0   3rd Qu.: 56.00  
 Max.   :25.0   Max.   :120.00

Including Plots
